result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewey Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) AMENDED FROM Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 1 self-help meeting per day until employed full time, and then 3 per week, for first year of probation and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: 90 days to be served, balance is stayed.  With Huber for work or work search. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Dewey Jackson in court with attorney Helmi Hamad for Nhu Huong Tran.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Nhu Huong Tran in court. Defendant does not appear.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Defense requests this matter be adjourned. BTC: Matter is adjourned.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Pick and Save, except for restitution purposes.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dewey Jackson in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Dewey Jackson in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
